    WorldHealth App

    WorldHealth Live Prototype

Project Description

WorldHealth App

The purpose of the project was to create an application either on a mobile device or on a tablet in order to design interactive product which helps users work towards on of the United Nation's 17 Global Goals

WorldHealth is an application that focuses on the United Nation goal of Good Health and Well-being. It is designed to primarily assist governments and world health organizations to track and plot confirmed cases of disease on a map. Furthermore, documentation is collected on confirmed cases such a images, reports, news articles etc...that individuals have access to through the application.

Research and Development

World Leaders have committed to 17 Global Goals to achieve 3 extraordinary things in the next 15 years. One of these 17 goals is Good Health and Well-being. As design the big question we need to ask ourselves is how can the exploding industry of call phones and other electronic devices help help the world around us? In term of the UN goal of Good health and Well-bring this question is more focused on how can we design technology to support medical professionals?

Art Direction

Once the flow of the application for solidified, research of competitors application was conducted in order to see how they approached the design of their apps. Additional, colour palette from Material Design were looked at in order to create one that suited the look and feel of WorldHealth app. Last of all, a logo was created to identify the application and what its purpose is.

Graphic Design Solution

As designer we have the power to change how people respond and react to the world around us. This project took a social issue that was present by the United Nations and through research and development a concept for a application promotes social good was created.

The final design for this tablet application was created to track and monitor potential health issues around the world. WorldHealth helps governments and health organization track how diseases spread, react to potential outbreaks and provide appropriate medical assistants to at risk areas or communities
